title: Shaharut
text:
Shaharut (, – "šaḥarūt") is a <a href="community%20settlement%20%28Israel%29">community settlement</a> in the far south of <a href="Israel">Israel</a>. Located 40 kilometers north of <a href="Eilat">Eilat</a>, and six kilometers west of <a href="Yotvata">Yotvata</a> on a ridge above the <a href="Arabah">Arabah</a> valley, it falls under the jurisdiction of <a href="Hevel%20Eilot%20Regional%20Council">Hevel Eilot Regional Council</a>. In it had a population of .
History.
The village was founded in 1985 by the <a href="Jewish%20Agency%20for%20Israel">Jewish Agency</a> and was named after the nearby Shaharut Mountain; the word "Shaharut" means "youth", as in <a href="Ecclesiastes">Ecclesiastes</a> chapter 11. It is the only settlement in the area that is not in the valley.
